column99: FPGA Engineer - SW Defined Radio Products
column100:
Ambitious NewSpace Company is looking for a skilled FPGA Engineer 
 
 In the GomSpace Radio Products team you have the possibility to work with the full range of FPGA disciplines from system design, over simulation, to writing HDL, run automated tests, and debug your design. 
 At GomSpace you will have the opportunity to work with build flow, design entry, synthesis, timing constraints and closure for the Xilinx SoC/FPGA platforms. 
 If you have senior hands-on experience with the above, you are a much-wanted candidate for the position which will have a large impact on our solutions. 
 You will join a team of skilled engineers spanning across SW, protocols, and FPGA. The team provides modem and signal processing functionality for our powerful Nanocom SDR hardware platform. 
 You thrive working in a small, dedicated team taking an iterative approach to development. You possess a strong personal drive, have a sense of ownership, and can’t wait to see  your  product fly in space inside a GomSpace satellite. Yes, it will get launched on a rocket - cool isn't it? 
 The job can include the following set of topics: 
 
 FPGA functionality for high-speed links (modems) and RF signal processing 
 Creation of proprietary IP block as well as integration of 3 rd  party IP blocks 
 RF sampling, timestamping, filtering, selection, and compression (spectrum monitoring / SigInt) 
 Design, prototyping, verification, and testing in automated build and test systems 
 Help determine the best placement of functionality across the interface between processing systems and the programmable logic on our SoC based SDR 
 Help project managers and product owners scope development work packages 
 
 We expect you to have the following qualifications: 
 
 Proficient in FPGA design using VHDL/Verilog, Vivado, and ModelSim. 
 Hans-on experience with debug equipment and methodology 
 Ideally you also have experience with C/C++ SW and Python scripts 
 Our satellites and SDR run a Linux OS. Therefore, our primary development platform is Linux. It is a massive benefit if you are comfortable with that already. 
 You work with an iterative and goal-oriented development mindset 
 Fluent in English on a professional level 
 3+ years of relevant experience would be beneficial 
 
 GomSpace offers employment in a dynamic growing and internationally oriented company with many challenging and exciting activities. We are an agenda-setting player in the nanosatellite business and expect our employees to contribute with dedication, skills and the will to implement our mission. We are ambitious and believe that nanosatellites and our efforts will make a difference to society in the future. We have an informal working culture with transparent communication and an organization built up by multidisciplinary skills and engineering passion which we believe are essential to help our customers achieve their goals in space.  
 Sign Up for Our Mission: 
 Apply for the job by following the link below. 
 You are welcome to send your application in either English or Danish. Interviews will be conducted on a continuous basis. 
We kindly draw your attention to the fact that we do not receive applications and resumes via e-mail or by personal appearance. This is to protect and show consideration for your personal information. 
 If you have questions do not hesitate to contact Head of Radio Products: 
 Bjarke Ebbesen  on  +45 42 90 70 38  or  ben@gomspace.com . 
 Workplace will at our fantastic facilities at Langagervej 6, Aalborg in Denmark. 
 Salary and start date will be individually negotiated. 
   
 About GomSpace  | GomSpace is a globally leading designer, integrator and manufacturer of high-end nanosatellites for customers in the academic, government and commercial markets. Our positions of strength include systems integration, nanosatellite subsystems and advanced miniaturised radio technology. Our international team is devoted to understanding our customer’s requirements and deliver flawlessly. We are listed in Stockholm (GOMX), headquartered in Denmark and have a subsidiary, NanoSpace in Sweden. We have currently more than 200 employees we service customers in more than 55 countries. Learn more: www.gomspace.com
